metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23210 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A floating point exception (divide-by-zero) issue was discovered in SoX in functon read_samples() of voc.c file. An attacker with a crafted file, could cause an application to crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23210` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
libsox3 - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
sox - 14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '14.4.2-3ubuntu0.18.04.2').
